TopicTitle: Problem with seams in Kerbin's terrain

Articles.Content:
I've noticed this bug... can anyone help?

There are these massive seams in the terrain of Kerbin. Every time I come to one, I literally have to hold my breath because when I cross them, the rover will either explode, bounce all over the place, flip up in the air, then explode. It happens with mod wheels (these are from the Buffalo mod by @Angel-125) and stock wheels. It never happened in 1.0.5 or in 1.1.3 (as bad as the wheels were there), and didn't happen until 1.2.1 came out.

On 04/11/2016 at 3:50 AM, adsii1970 said:

didn't happen until 1.2.1 came out

I've definitely seen those in 1.2 as well.

 

EDIT: It appears the seams are more pronounced in 1.2.1 though; I'm having a hard time using the airstrips at KSC and the Island especially with retractable landing gears (the fixed gears seem to take it better), that wasn't a problem in 1.2 before. I don't have a vanilla KSP install right now to compare to, but I suspect it isn't a mod issue.

Edited November 10, 2016 by Corax

Had this in 1,2 and 1.2.1 as well, turning the terrain detail down to default seems to stop it. The lines are still visible but don't seem as "stepped" as before, run over them at 30 m/s with no ill effects.
